headline.main: Fresh Pain at Plaza Downtown; Refurbished Vietnam Memorial Is Dedicated, 11/9/01

lead_paragraph: In the end, the World Trade Center tragedy never stopped intruding. Speakers at the dedication yesterday of a $7 million plaza memorializing New York City's fallen Vietnam warriors kept looking ahead to Veterans Day while looking back on the city's centuries-old relationship with martial tradition.
abstract: Refurbished New York City Vietnam Veterans Memorial is dedicated at new Vietnam Veterans Plaza at 55 Water Street; suffocating smell of ground zero swirls on riverside winds past speakers' platform into crowd of 2,000 veterans, family members and visitors, who come to dedicate 12 new granite pylons bearing alphabetically arranged names of 1,741 New Yorkers who died during Vietnam War; photos (L)

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: NEW YORK CITY VIETNAM VETERANS MEMORIAL
